column4: Morgan Stanley to take $1.25 billion hit in fourth-quarter from tax bill
column5: Morgan Stanley  said on Friday it would take a $1.25 billion hit in its fourth-quarter earnings due to a cut in corporate tax rate as part of the U.S. tax code overhaul. | Video

column4: UPDATE 1-Morgan Stanley to take $1.25 bln hit in Q4 from tax bill
column5: Jan 5 Morgan Stanley said on Friday it would take a $1.25 billion hit in its fourth-quarter earnings due to a cut in corporate tax rate as part of the U.S. tax code overhaul. The net blow of the bill to the bank will include about a $1.4 billion net discrete tax provision  mainly due to the remeasurement of certain net deferred tax assets using the lowered corporate tax rate  the company said in a filing.

The net blow of the bill to the bank will include about a $1.4 billion net discrete tax provision  mainly due to the remeasurement of certain net deferred tax assets using the lowered corporate tax rate  the company said in a filing.

column4: Verizon removes Bloomberg TV  refusing to pay carriage fees
column5: Verizon Communications Inc has pulled Bloomberg L.P.'s news network  Bloomberg TV  from 4.6 million of its pay-TV customers after the financial news provider asked the carrier to pay it for its content for the first time ever.

column4: Internet Association to join expected net neutrality lawsuit
column5: WASHINGTON  Jan 5 The Internet Association  a trade group representing companies such as Google parent Alphabet Inc and Facebook Inc  said on Friday it intends to join an expected lawsuit against a decision to roll back net neutrality rules.

column4: Wells Fargo withdraws arbitration bid in unauthorized accounts lawsuit
column5: Customers suing Wells Fargo in Utah over its practice of opening unauthorized accounts will have their day in court after the bank dropped its bid to force the case into arbitration.
